Middle Discourses 1

The Root of All Things
meta:
Bhikkhu Sujato

Translated into English from the Pali text from the Mahāsaṅgīti Tipiṭaka Buddhavasse 2500

segments.segment3.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Ukkaṭṭhā, in the Subhaga Forest at the root of magnificent sal tree.
segments.segment3.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
segments.segment3.7: “Mendicants, I will teach you the explanation of the root of all things.
segments.segment3.8: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
segments.segment4.1: “Take an uneducated ordinary person who has not seen the noble ones, and is neither skilled nor trained in their teaching. They’ve not seen good persons, and are neither skilled nor trained in their teaching.
segments.segment4.3: But then they conceive earth, they conceive regarding earth, they conceive as earth, they conceive that ‘earth is mine’, they enjoy earth.
segments.segment4.5: Because they haven’t completely understood it, I say.

segments.segment29.1: A mendicant who is a trainee, who hasn’t achieved their heart’s desire, but lives aspiring for the supreme sanctuary, directly know earth as earth.
segments.segment29.2: But they shouldn’t conceive earth, they shouldn’t conceive regarding earth, they shouldn’t conceive as earth, they shouldn’t conceive that ‘earth is mine’, they shouldn’t enjoy earth.
segments.segment29.4: So that they may completely understand it, I say.

segments.segment44.1: The Realized One, the Perfected One, the fully awakened Buddha directly knows earth as earth.
segments.segment44.2: But he doesn’t conceive earth, he doesn’t conceive regarding earth, he doesn’ t conceive as earth, he doesn’t conceive that ‘earth is mine’, he doesn’t enjoy earth.
segments.segment44.4: Because the Realized One has completely understood it to the end, I say.

segments.segment47.1: The Realized One, the Perfected One, the fully awakened Buddha directly knows earth as earth.
segments.segment47.2: But he doesn’t conceive earth, he doesn’t conceive regarding earth, he doesn’ t conceive as earth, he doesn’t conceive that ‘earth is mine’, he doesn’t enjoy earth.
segments.segment47.4: Because he has understood that relishing is the root of suffering,
segments.segment47.5: and that birth comes from the ongoing process of existence; whoever has come to be gets old and dies.
segments.segment47.6: That’s why the Realized One—with the ending, fading away, cessation, giving up, and letting go of all cravings—has awakened to the supreme perfect Awakening, I say.
